metadata.title: CVE-2024-0775 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the __ext4_remount in fs/ext4/super.c inext4 in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local user to cause aninformation leak problem while freeing the old quota file names before apotential failure, leading to a use-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic-64k - 6.5.0-14.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-14.14').
linux-aws package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-raspi package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-starfive package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
